Description.En:
How can we design AI learning assistants to transform the way learners discover and navigate opportunities within the ECIU learning environment? This challenge invites you to rethink how personalised guidance can empower learners to achieve their goals. Using cutting-edge AI technologies, you'll co-create solutions that support diverse learner and professional needs and preferences while exploring the digital landscape with Microsoft Co-pilot platform and Virtual Reality with Microsoft Mesh environment where you can interact with your own digital avatars in a virtual classroom.

Through a dynamic program combining online sessions and an intensive three-day workshop at Tampere university, you will learn how to create AI agents capable of providing personalized assistance in learning and competence development, such as in the ECIU Engage platform. With opportunities to design assistants with different characteristics, response styles, and functionalities, you’ll have the freedom to create, innovate and experiment. Guided by workshops, expert mentoring, and peer collaboration, you’ll develop a prototype that balances ease of use, response accuracy, and effective learner guidance. Your designs will be evaluated by AI specialists, pushing you to deliver impactful, practical solutions.

By joining this challenge, you’ll develop AI prototypes that serve as personalised assistants for assisting individuals in learning and in competence development in digital environments (AI chatbot) or Virtual Realities (AI avatar). The prototypes can contribute to navigating the ECIU Engage platform and make a lasting contribution to the way ECIU offers learner guidance, designed for students, by students! These assistants will offer tailored guidance, adapt to individual learner styles, and potentially integrate seamlessly into the existing Engage platform. The final prototypes will be evaluated by AI experts based on usability, accuracy, and effectiveness in supporting learner journeys. The potential for further development by the ECIU will be evaluated as well.

The ECIU AI hackathon is organized in collaboration with Gameful Realities research center and EVIL-AI project.

NoteLiteral.En: Demonstrate  practical knowledge in AI systems, virtual reality, and how these tools are applicable to learner guidance

Title.En: Design and development process for prototyping innovative assistants

NoteLiteral.En: After completing the course, participants are able to understand the design and development process for prototyping innovative assistants in the digital and VR environments

Title.En: Creating AI assistants to different types of users

NoteLiteral.En: After completing the course, participants are able to recognise different learner profiles and to create different AI assistants that have different response styles and are responsive to different users.

Title.En: Team working and innovative thinking skills

NoteLiteral.En: After completing the course, participants are able to work collaboratively in teams, generate ideas in a creative and innovative way and solve problems effectively.

MoreInformation.NoteLiteral:
You will work in teams to address the ‘wicked problem’ of developing personalised learning assistants for the 21st century to suit a variety of user needs. Thinking broadly to begin with, as you explore the AI tools provided prior to the hackathon and then in workshop style during it, you will work in teams to create either a text-based AI assistant chatbot with Microsoft Co-pilot or an AI avatar assistant in the Microsoft Mesh Virtual Reality (VR) environment, or both.  You will have the opportunity to unleash your creative and imaginative potential, and you can also think about including elements of gamification. It will also be important to consider the user experience and ethical implications of AI, data capture and personalisation.  

The final prototypes will be judged by AI experts on criteria such as ease of use, response accuracy, ability to guide the competence development of individuals and so on.  

During this whole course you will:

- Collaborate with a diverse team of peers, mentors, and stakeholders.
- Design, test, and refine AI agents tailored to unique learner needs.
- Experiment with Microsoft co-pilot for chatbot creation and/or Mesh environment for VR avatar creation to enhance the learning experience.
- Learn advanced techniques in AI development, user experience design, and educational innovation.

The challenge kicks off with online sessions to introduce you to the tools, methods, and goals of AI development for personalised learning and the suggested readings will be explained.

**Timeline:**

Feb 26th online kick-off

Feb 26th – March 11th participants work in teams with pre-materials

March 11th-14th in-person programme at Paidia, Tampere, where you’ll be guided by expert coaching and supported by interactive workshops and you’ll translate your ideas into functional AI solution.. Programme also includes social activities in the evenings

March 14th-28th final report writing and online wrap-up session

All work activities are mandatory to receive the 2 ECTS via Tampere university and a Micro-Credential from ECIU University

**Programme of the three-day in-person workshop in Tampere**   

The physical sessions will take place at the Paidia centre in Tampere. The provisional programme is as follows:  

March 11th Arrivals  

March 12th, Day 1: 9:00 Kick-off and Ideation  

March 13th Day 2: Development and Prototyping

March 14th Day 3: Finalisation and Presentation including  

Judging and Deliberation  

Award Ceremony. Finish 16:00

**Follow up:**

In groups you will be required to submit a 2–5-page report maximum 2 weeks after the hackathon.  This will be evaluated by the ECIU hackathon team and microcredentials will be issued from Engage to Europass wallets.  

The successful completion of the ECIU AI assistant hackathon requires:

(1) completing the three day-hackathon in Paidia, Tampere,

(2) presenting the prototypes in the hackathon

(3) completion of a short 2–5 page report of the prototype.

The final report can be written during the event or afterwards, and includes the following information at minimum:  

• Short concept: What is the idea of the prototype, how does it work, who is it for, what problem does it solve?  

• Demo link or screenshots  

• Responsible use: What kind of risks or negative effects could be linked to the use of the AI assistant (e.g., ethical issues, misuse, technostress)? How to mitigate the  potential negative effects?

**Suggested readings:**

Materials will be provided to participants depending on their focus in the Hackathon (i.e., creating a chatbot via co-pilot or creating an AI avatar assistant with Microsoft Mesh):

- [How to create agents in Microsoft co-pilot studio](https://eur04.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Flearn.microsoft.com%2Fen-us%2Ftraining%2Fpaths%2Fcreate-extend-custom-copilots-microsoft-copilot-studio%2F&data=05%7C02%7Csanna.kivimaki%40tuni.fi%7Cea6dad71bddb4811b38f08dd1f5746ec%7Cfa6944afcc7c4cd89154c01132798910%7C0%7C0%7C638701181922871595%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJFbXB0eU1hcGkiOnRydWUsIlYiOiIwLjAuMDAwMCIsIlAiOiJXaW4zMiIsIkFOIjoiTWFpbCIsIldUIjoyfQ%3D%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=wOgALyVYUM5lXyS8w8NCMDDE8HKwZ6WoiIylZ2q7kEk%3D&reserved=0)

After completing the hackathon the students will receive a Micro-Credential via Email where skills applicable to the learning outcomes will be indicated.
Creating learner guidance AI tools for the digital and virtual environments

This is your chance to shape the next generation of personalised learner guidance and competence development tools! Join us in redefining how learners and professionals engage with the ECIU learning environment by developing innovative AI assistants tailored to individual needs. Together, we’ll transform the way learners and professionals can navigate opportunities and receive guidance to assist in their personal development. 

Join us to gain advanced skills, cutting-edge insights, and hands-on experience in AI-driven educational innovation. Be part of a community shaping the future of learning!

The ECIU AI hackathon is organized in collaboration with Gameful Realities research center and EVIL-AI project.

**Who is it for?**

Although AI programming (and Unity experience for VR) may be essential depending on your scenario, we also welcome participants from versatile backgrounds to join in order to have complementary skillsets in each team. For example, we invite participants with interest in behavioural and social sciences, educational psychology and learning theory. The hackathon is meant for students who have 60 ECTS of university studies.

**How to apply?**

To enter the challenge, you must apply in the Engage platform. Please write a motivation letter of 300-800 words in which you express your preference for one of the following three sub-challenges so that we can create teams for the challenges:

- Challenge One: Develop a chatbot with Microsoft Co-pilot
- Challenge Two: Develop an AI Avatar design for VR with Unity and Microsoft Mesh
- Challenge Three: Wildcard-develop totally different kind of AI assistant with the tools of your liking

Your motivation letter should outline the following, please specify:

- What kind of AI assistant is needed? (What would an AI avatar do to help humans? Please specify a scenario in which the AI assistant would be particularly useful.

- Where? This scenario can be about learning or even extend to the world of work where individuals or groups of people could be assisted with AI.

- For whom? (e.g., students in universities, lifelong learners in companies)

- Why? (e.g., what problem would an AI assistant solve?)

- Mention the Challenge (1, 2 or 3) that you would approach. Please relate your idea to the societal themes and challenges outlined in the call.

- Pitch of you: what is your field of study and/or programme? What skills and positive attitudes would you bring to the hackathon? Please outline what your role could be in a team that is conceptualising and developing the AI assistant.

- What kind of team would you like to work with? What kind of complementary skills would be helpful

You’ll be notified if you make it to the hackathon (30 slots for students) and assigned to teams (groups of 3 to 5 individuals). Selection will be based on the strength of the motivation letter and to ensure good balance across disciplines and across ECIU universities.

**This learning opportunity requires physical presence in Tampere. For this mobility each ECIU university partner may fund up to two students to the hackathon. Support from your institution is required and admission will also be impacted by the possibility of funding for your mobility to Tampere. For more information or queries as to whether your institution can provide funding for your travel, please send a request to the ECIU Service Centre via this [form](https://engage.eciu.eu/contact).**
